WslCommand.Command:
count=`ls -1 $[I.]$[V.[SampleName]]*.fastq 2>/dev/null | wc -l`
if [ $count != 0 ]
then 
conda run -n seqtk seqtk seq -A $[I.]$[V.[SampleName]]*.fastq > $[O.]sample.fasta
fi 
count=`ls -1 $[I.]$[V.[SampleName]]*.fastq.gz 2>/dev/null | wc -l`
if [ $count != 0 ]
then 
conda run -n seqtk seqtk seq -A $[I.]$[V.[SampleName]]*.fastq.gz > $[O.]sample.fasta
fi

mkdir $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]
conda run -n seqdb bbmap.sh nodisk=f threads=6 ref=$[I.]sample.fasta in=$[I.]sample.fasta  covstats=$[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/covstats.txt covhist=$[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/covhist.txt bincov=$[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/bincov.txt

mkdir $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]
cp $[I{DragonFlye}.]contigs.fa $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/$[V.[SampleName]]_contigs.fasta
cp $[I{DragonFlye}.]flye.fasta $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/$[V.[SampleName]]_flye.fa
cp $[I{DragonFlye}.]flye-info.txt $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/$[V.[SampleName]]_flye-info.txt
cp $[I{DragonFlye}.]dragonflye.log $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/$[V.[SampleName]]_dragonflye.log

if [ -f "$[I{Abricate}.]$[V.[SampleName]]_Abricate_Output.tsv" ]; then
   cp $[I{Abricate}.]$[V.[SampleName]]_Abricate_Output.tsv $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/$[V.[SampleName]]_Abricate_Output.tsv
fi

# Create a temporary file for writing the modified content
tempfile=$[O.]tmp_$[V.[SampleName]]
touch "$tempfile"
# This script changes the text of a file for each line that starts with '>'
# Replace the word that follows the '>' with 'SAMPLE', followed by space and then everything that was originally on the line after the '>'
filename=$[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/$[V.[SampleName]]_contigs.fasta
# Loop through each line of the file
while read -r line; do
  # Check if the line starts with '>'
  if [[ $line == '>'* ]]; then
    # Extract the word that follows the '>'
    word=$(echo $line | cut -d' ' -f1 | cut -c2-)
    # Replace the word with SAMPLENAME
    line=${line/$word/$[V.[SampleName]] $word}
    echo $line
  fi
  # Print the modified line
  echo "$line" >> "$tempfile"
done < $filename
# Replace the original file with the modified content
mv "$tempfile" $filename
touch "$tempfile"
# Do the same with the second file.
filename=$[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/$[V.[SampleName]]_flye.fa
# Loop through each line of the file
while read -r line; do
  # Check if the line starts with '>'
  if [[ $line == '>'* ]]; then
    # Extract the word that follows the '>'
    word=$(echo $line | cut -d' ' -f1 | cut -c2-)
    # Replace the word with SAMPLENAME
    line=${line/$word/$[V.[SampleName]] $word}
    echo $line
  fi
  # Print the modified line
  echo "$line" >> "$tempfile"
done < $filename
# Replace the original file with the modified content
mv "$tempfile" $filename
# Copy fasta files but add ' sample_id='<sampleID>' to headers
cp $[I{DragonFlye}.]contigs.fa $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/contigs.fasta
touch "$tempfile"
awk '/^>/ {print $0" sample_id=$[V.[SampleName]]"} !/^>/ {print $0}' $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/contigs.fasta > "$tempfile"
mv "$tempfile" $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/contigs.fasta
cp $[I{DragonFlye}.]flye.fasta $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/flye.fa
touch "$tempfile"
awk '/^>/ {print $0" sample_id=$[V.[SampleName]]"} !/^>/ {print $0}' $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/flye.fa > "$tempfile"
mv "$tempfile" $[O{DragonFlye}.]$[V.[SampleName]]/flye.fa

count=`ls -1 $[D.[SamplePath]]*.fastq 2>/dev/null | wc -l`
if [ $count != 0 ]
then 
cat $[D.[SamplePath]]*.fastq > $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]].fastq
gzip -f $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]].fastq 2>&1 > /dev/null;
fi 
count=`ls -1 $[D.[SamplePath]]*.fastq.gz 2>/dev/null | wc -l`
if [ $count != 0 ]
then 
cat $[D.[SamplePath]]*.fastq.gz > $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]].fastq.gz
fi

conda run -n dragonflye nanoq --min-len 1000 -r $[O.]nanoq_report.csv -H --input $[I.]*.fastq* --min-qual 0  1> $[O.]READS.filt.fq 
rm $[O.]READS.filt.fq
sed -i -e 's/ /,/g' $[O.]nanoq_report.csv
#FS IsDocker
# Add write mode because if run in Docker, we need to be able to delete this file from WSL2.
chmod a+w $[O.]nanoq_report.csv
#FS End

conda run -n busco busco -m genome -f -i $[I.]contigs.fa --out_path $[O.] -o $[V.[SampleName]] -l @[lineage=bacteria_odb10]
rm -rf $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/logs
rm -rf $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/prodigal_output
rm -rf $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/run_@[lineage=bacteria_odb10]
rm -rf $[o.]/busco_downloads

ScriptParmsList.Description: Select a Busco lineage database from the dropdown.

WslCommand.Command:
cmd='/usr/local/quast-5.0.2/quast.py -o $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/Quast/ --glimmer $[I.]contigs.fa'
#FS IsDocker
cmd='conda run -n quast quast.py -o $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/Quast/ --glimmer $[I.]contigs.fa'
#FS End
eval "$cmd"

# Refseq_masher does not play well with the raven assembler. Recommend use flye.
mkdir $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]
#FS IsDocker
#FS End
conda run -n refseq_masher refseq_masher matches --output-type csv -o $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/RefseqIdent.csv $[I.]$[V.[SampleName]]/

mkdir $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]
cmd='/usr/local/kraken2/kraken2 --db @[db=/mnt/e/data/reference/databases/minikraken2_v1_8GB/] --threads @[threads=20] --report $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/kraken.aggregates.txt --use-names --output $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/kraken.txt $[I.]/contigs.fa'
#FS IsDocker
#FS DockerMap /mnt/e/data/reference/databases/
cmd='conda run -n kraken2 kraken2 --db @[db=/mnt/e/data/reference/databases/minikraken2_v1_8GB/] --threads @[threads=20] --report $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/kraken.aggregates.txt --use-names --output $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]/kraken.txt $[I.]/contigs.fa'
#FS End
eval "$cmd"

ScriptParmsList.Description: Leave blank for DragonFlye to estimate based on kmers; otherwise use '--gsize @[gsize=n]'.
Estimated genome size in number of bases, if gsizeParm is blank.
Ignore - Number of rounds of Racon polishing will be inserted into this parameter.
Choose Medaka model from combo dropdown.
Ignore - Number of rounds of Medaka polishing will be inserted into this parameter.
With --nopolish, tell DragonFlye we want to polish with Medaka and/or Racon.

GlobalScriptModules.Comment: 2022-09-22 12:25 AGB465: The awk command has the effect of concatenting all the nanoq reports and retaining just one copy of the header.

WslCommand.Command:
echo "DragonFlye Sink $[I{nanoq}.] $[O.] runs to consolidate all nanoq reports."
#FS ForEachPrereq
cp $[I{nanoq}.]nanoq_report.csv $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]nanoq_report.csv
rm $[I{nanoq}.]nanoq_report.csv
#FS End
awk 'FNR==1 && NR!=1{next;}{print}' $[O.]*.csv > $[O.]master_nanoq_report.csv
#FS ForEachPrereq
rm $[O.]$[V.[SampleName]]nanoq_report.csv
#FS End

ScriptParmsList.Description: Provide a database against which to search for genes.

CommandList.Command:
count=`ls -1 /mnt/e/data/Dreamer/PDS_Diagnostics_2022/PDS2221084-2_Brucella_ovis_6Jul22_II/PDS2221084-2_Brucella_ovis_6Jul22_II/20220706_1235_X4_FAT43517_2f710a8b/fastq_pass/*.fastq 2>/dev/null | wc -l`
if [ $count != 0 ]
then 
cat /mnt/e/data/Dreamer/PDS_Diagnostics_2022/PDS2221084-2_Brucella_ovis_6Jul22_II/PDS2221084-2_Brucella_ovis_6Jul22_II/20220706_1235_X4_FAT43517_2f710a8b/fastq_pass/*.fastq > /mnt/c/BioSeqDB/WSLProxyRoot/DHP565/Work/DragonFlye_Assembly/D1C1/fastq_pass.fastq
gzip -f /mnt/c/BioSeqDB/WSLProxyRoot/DHP565/Work/DragonFlye_Assembly/D1C1/fastq_pass.fastq 2>&1 > /dev/null;
fi 

count=`ls -1 /mnt/e/data/Dreamer/PDS_Diagnostics_2022/PDS2221084-2_Brucella_ovis_6Jul22_II/PDS2221084-2_Brucella_ovis_6Jul22_II/20220706_1235_X4_FAT43517_2f710a8b/fastq_pass/*.fastq.gz 2>/dev/null | wc -l`
if [ $count != 0 ]
then 
cat /mnt/e/data/Dreamer/PDS_Diagnostics_2022/PDS2221084-2_Brucella_ovis_6Jul22_II/PDS2221084-2_Brucella_ovis_6Jul22_II/20220706_1235_X4_FAT43517_2f710a8b/fastq_pass/*.fastq.gz > /mnt/c/BioSeqDB/WSLProxyRoot/DHP565/Work/DragonFlye_Assembly/D1C1/fastq_pass.fastq.gz
fi

conda run -n dragonflye dragonflye --force  --cpus 4 --assembler flye  --nanohq --medaka 1 --model r103_fast_g507 --racon 1 --reads /mnt/c/BioSeqDB/WSLProxyRoot/DHP565/Work/DragonFlye_Assembly/D1C1/fastq_pass.fastq* --outdir /mnt/c/BioSeqDB/WSLProxyRoot/DHP565/Work/DragonFlye_Assembly/D1C3/ 0
